mcpy.energies package¶

Submodules¶

mcpy.energies.numba_energies module¶

This module contains the numba optimised functions for the energy terms, change in energy calculations and implementions for specific cases encountered during my thesis. The functions are called in the numba compiled total energy function in mcpyEnergies umba_energies.py

mcpy.energies.numba_energies.anisotropy_energy(grid: ndarray, anisotropy_K: float64, anisotropy_u: ndarray, dx: float64, dy: float64, dz: float64) → float64¶

Calculate the anisotropy energy of the system

Parameters:

  • grid (np.array) – 3D vector field

  • anisotropy_K (np.float64) – Anisotropy constant

  • anisotropy_u (np.array) – Anisotropy axis

  • dx (np.float64) – x discretisation of the grid

  • dy (np.float64) – y discretisation of the grid

  • dz (np.float64) – z discretisation of the grid

Returns:

Anisotropy energy of the system

Return type:

np.float64

mcpy.energies.numba_energies.delta_energy(grid: ndarray, spins: ndarray, Ms: float64, zeeman_H: ndarray, exchange_A: float64, anisotropy_K: float64, anisotropy_u: ndarray, dmi_D: ndarray, dx: float64, dy: float64, dz: float64) → float64¶

Calculate the energy difference between the current state and the proposed state. Uses ‘Conv_z’ point group for DMI energy calculation.

Parameters:

  • grid (np.array) – 3D vector field

  • spins (np.array) – (Previous and proposed) spin configuration

  • Ms (float) – Saturation magnetisation

  • zeeman_H (np.array) – Zeeman field

  • exchange_A (np.float64) – Exchange constant

  • anisotropy_K (np.float64) – Anisotropy constant

  • anisotropy_u (np.array) – Anisotropy axis

  • dmi_D (np.array) – DMI constant

  • dx (np.float64) – x discretisation of the grid

  • dy (np.float64) – y discretisation of the grid

  • dz (np.float64) – z discretisation of the grid

Returns:

Energy difference between the current state and the proposed state

Return type:

np.float64

mcpy.energies.numba_energies.delta_energy2(grid_ex: ndarray, grid_dmi: ndarray, spins: ndarray, Ms: float64, zeeman_H: ndarray, exchange_A: float64, anisotropy_K: float64, anisotropy_u: ndarray, dmi_D: ndarray, dx: float64, dy: float64, dz: float64) → float64¶
Calculate the energy difference between the current state and the proposed state. Uses ‘T or O’ point group for DMI energy calculation.

For Bloch point simulations

Parameters:

  • grid_ex (np.ndarray) – 5x5x5 grid for exchange with neumann boundary conditions

  • grid_dmi (np.ndarray) – 5x5x5 grid for DMI with dirichlet boundary conditions

  • spins (np.ndarray) – (Previous and proposed) spin configuration

  • Ms (np.float64) – Saturation magnetisation

  • zeeman_H (np.ndarray) – Zeeman field

  • exchange_A (np.float64) – Exchange constant

  • anisotropy_K (np.float64) – Anisotropy constant

  • anisotropy_u (np.ndarray) – Anisotropy axis

  • dmi_D (np.ndarray) – DMI constant

  • dx (np.float64) – x discretisation of the grid

  • dy (np.float64) – y discretisation of the grid

  • dz (np.float64) – z discretisation of the grid

  • Returns – np.float64: Energy difference between the current state and the proposed state

mcpy.energies.numba_energies.dmi_Cnvz(grid: ndarray, D: ndarray, dx: float64, dy: float64, dz: float64) → float64¶

Calculate the DMI energy of the system. Uses ‘Cnv_z’ point group for DMI energy calculation.

Parameters:

  • grid (np.array) – 3D vector field

  • D (np.array) – DMI constant grid

  • dx (np.float64) – x discretisation of the grid

  • dy (np.float64) – y discretisation of the grid

  • dz (np.float64) – z discretisation of the grid

Returns:

DMI energy of the system

Return type:

np.float64

mcpy.energies.numba_energies.exchange_energy(grid: ndarray, exchange_A: float64, dx: float64, dy: float64, dz: float64) → float64¶

Calculate the exchange energy of the system

Parameters:

  • grid (np.array) – 3D vector field

  • exchange_A (np.float64) – Exchange constant

  • dx (np.float64) – x discretisation of the grid

  • dy (np.float64) – y discretisation of the grid

  • dz (np.float64) – z discretisation of the grid

Returns:

Exchange energy of the system

Return type:

np.float64

>>> grid = np.ones((5, 5, 5, 3))
>>> exchange_energy(grid, 1, 1, 1, 1)
-96.0
mcpy.energies.numba_energies.numba_delta(grid_ex: ndarray, grid_dmi: ndarray, spins: ndarray, Ms: float64, zeeman_H: ndarray, exchange_A: float64, anisotropy_K: float64, anisotropy_u: ndarray, dmi_D: ndarray, Dtype: str, dx: float64, dy: float64, dz: float64) → float64¶

Calculates the change in energy between the current state and the proposed state. Uses numba compiled functions for energy calculation.

Parameters:

  • grid_ex (np.ndarray) – 5x5x5 grid for exchange with neumann boundary conditions

  • grid_dmi (np.ndarray) – 5x5x5 grid for DMI with dirichlet boundary conditions

  • spins (np.ndarray) – (Previous and proposed) spin configuration

  • Ms (float) – Saturation magnetisation

  • zeeman_H (np.ndarray) – Zeeman field

  • exchange_A (np.float64) – Exchange constant

  • anisotropy_K (np.float64) – Anisotropy constant

  • anisotropy_u (np.ndarray) – Anisotropy axis

  • dmi_D (np.ndarray) – DMI constant

  • Dtype (str) – DMI type or Crystal class

  • dx (np.float64) – x discretisation of the grid

  • dy (np.float64) – y discretisation of the grid

  • dz (np.float64) – z discretisation of the grid

Returns:

Change in energy between the current state and the proposed state

Return type:

np.float64

mcpy.energies.numba_energies.zeeman_energy(grid: ndarray, zeeman_H: ndarray, Ms: float64, dx: float64, dy: float64, dz: float64) → float64¶

Calculate the Zeeman energy of the system

Parameters:

  • grid (np.array) – 3D vector field

  • zeeman_H (np.array) – Zeeman field

  • Ms (np.float64) – Saturation magnetisation

  • dx (np.float64) – x discretisation of the grid

  • dy (np.float64) – y discretisation of the grid

  • dz (np.float64) – z discretisation of the grid

Returns:

Zeeman energy of the system

Return type:

np.float64

mcpy.energies.numpy_energies module¶

mcpy.energies.numpy_energies.anisotropy_energy(grid: ndarray, anisotropy_K: float64, anisotropy_u: ndarray, dx: float64, dy: float64, dz: float64) → float64¶

Calculates the anisotropy energy of the system

Parameters:

  • grid (np.ndarray) – 3D array of spins

  • anisotropy_K (np.float64) – Anisotropy constant

  • anisotropy_u (np.ndarray) – Anisotropy axis

  • dx (np.float64) – Grid spacing in x direction

  • dy (np.float64) – Grid spacing in y direction

  • dz (np.float64) – Grid spacing in z direction

Returns:

Anisotropy energy of the system

Return type:

energy (np.float64)

>>> grid = np.ones((5, 5, 5, 3))
>>> anisotropy_K = 1
>>> anisotropy_u = np.array([0, 0, 1])
>>> dx, dy, dz = np.array([1, 1, 1])
>>> anisotropy_energy(grid, anisotropy_K, anisotropy_u, dx, dy, dz)
0.0
mcpy.energies.numpy_energies.dmi_energy(grid: ndarray, Dtype: str, D: ndarray, dx: float64, dy: float64, dz: float64) → float64¶

Calculates the DMI energy of the system

Parameters:

  • grid (np.ndarray) – 3D array of spins

  • Dtype (str) – DMI type or Crystal class

  • D (np.ndarray) – DMI constant for the segmented 5x5x5 grid

  • dx (np.float64) – Grid spacing in x direction

  • dy (np.float64) – Grid spacing in y direction

  • dz (np.float64) – Grid spacing in z direction

Returns:

DMI energy of the system

Return type:

energy (np.float64)

>>> grid = np.ones((5, 5, 5, 3))
>>> Dtype = 'D2d_z'
>>> D = 1
>>> dx, dy, dz = np.array([1, 1, 1])
>>> dmi_energy(grid, Dtype, D, dx, dy, dz)
0.0
mcpy.energies.numpy_energies.exchange_energy(grid: ndarray, exchange_A: float64, dx: float64, dy: float64, dz: float64) → float64¶

Calculates the exchange energy of the system

Parameters:

  • grid (np.ndarray) – 3D array of spins

  • exchange_A (np.float64) – Exchange constant

  • dx (np.float64) – Grid spacing in x direction

  • dy (np.float64) – Grid spacing in y direction

  • dz (np.float64) – Grid spacing in z direction

Returns:

Exchange energy of the system

Return type:

energy (np.float64)

>>> grid = np.ones((5, 5, 5, 3))
>>> exchange_A = 1
>>> dx, dy, dz = np.array([1, 1, 1])
>>> exchange_energy(grid, exchange_A, dx, dy, dz)
-500.0
mcpy.energies.numpy_energies.numpy_delta(grid, spins: ndarray, grid_ex: ndarray, grid_dmi: ndarray, D: ndarray, zeeman_H: ndarray) → float64¶

Calculates the change in energy of the system using numpy

Parameters:

  • grid (Grid) – Grid object

  • spins (np.ndarray) – Array of spins

  • grid_ex (np.ndarray) – Exchange grid

  • grid_dmi (np.ndarray) – DMI grid

Returns:

Change in energy of the system

Return type:

delta (np.float64)

>>> grid = np.ones((5, 5, 5, 3))
>>> spins = np.array([[1, 0, 0], [0, 1, 0]])
>>> grid_ex = np.ones((5, 5, 5, 3))
>>> grid_dmi = np.ones((5, 5, 5, 3))
>>> D = 1
>>> zeeman_H = np.array([0, 0, 1])
>>> numpy_delta(grid, spins, grid_ex, grid_dmi, D, zeeman_H)
0.0
mcpy.energies.numpy_energies.zeeman_energy(grid: ndarray, zeeman_H: ndarray, Ms: float64, dx: float64, dy: float64, dz: float64) → float64¶

Calculates the Zeeman energy of the system

Parameters:

  • grid (np.ndarray) – 3D array of spins

  • zeeman_H (np.ndarray) – External magnetic field

  • Ms (np.float64) – Saturation magnetisation

  • dx (np.float64) – Grid spacing in x direction

  • dy (np.float64) – Grid spacing in y direction

  • dz (np.float64) – Grid spacing in z direction

Returns:

Zeeman energy of the system

Return type:

energy (np.float64)

>>> grid = np.ones((5, 5, 5, 3))
>>> zeeman_H = np.array([0, 0, 1])
>>> Ms = 10
>>> dx, dy, dz = np.array([1, 1, 1])
>>> zeeman_energy(grid, zeeman_H, Ms, dx, dy, dz)
-500.0
